forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. Southwest wind 7 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the city basks in a gentle embrace of partly cloudy skies, the temperature settling comfortably around 54 degrees. A moderate southwest breeze flutters through the streets, occasionally stirring up playful gusts that tap dance to a rhythm known only to the evening air. Though the horizon hints at clarion moments, shadows linger in the nooks and crannies, hinting at a persistent marine layer that hugs the coastline, possibly reluctant to depart entirely.

Tomorrow promises a brighter chapter as the sun ascends, bringing warmth to the day with highs soaring to approximately 64 degrees. The sunlight will coax the clouds aside, revealing a luminous canopy overhead, as temperatures gracefully glide down into the afternoon. With weather like this, donning layers becomes a necessity; a light jacket or cardigan is ideal for those early morning ventures, while a simple t-shirt and comfortable trousers may suffice as the sun reaches its zenith. 

With these pleasant conditions, the city invites leisurely strolls through the storied streets—perhaps a visit to a quiet café where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the light breeze, or a midday jaunt through one of the lush parks dotting the landscape. Whether indulging in a serene moment of reflection or engaging in light-hearted conversation among friends, there is an undeniable charm in the air, urging residents and visitors alike to step outside and savor the fleeting beauty of a San Francisco summer day.
